dt: used as a function word to indicate a point of reckoning
used as a function word to indicate origin or derivation
used as a function word to indicate the cause, motive, or reason
used as a function word to indicate the component material, parts, or elements or the contents
used as a function word to indicate the whole that includes the part denoted by the preceding word
used as a function word to indicate a whole or quantity from which a part is removed or expended
used as a function word to indicate belonging or a possessive relationship
used as a function word to indicate relationship between a result determined by a function or operation and a basic entity (such as an independent variable)
used as a function word to indicate something from which a person or thing is delivered
or with respect to which someone or something is made destitute
used as a function word to indicate a particular example belonging to the class denoted by the preceding noun
used as a function word to indicate apposition
used as a function word to indicate the object of an action denoted or implied by the preceding noun
used as a function word to indicate the application of a verb
used as a function word to indicate a characteristic or distinctive quality or possession
used as a function word to indicate the position in time of an action or occurrence

et: Middle English, off, of, from Old English, adverb & preposition; akin to Old High German {it}aba{/it} off, away, Latin {it}ab{/it} from, away, Greek {it}apo{/it}
shortdef: —used as a function word to indicate a point of reckoning
—used as a function word to indicate origin or derivation
—used as a function word to indicate the cause, motive, or reason

dt: used in place of the contraction {it}'ve{/it} often in representations of uneducated speech

shortdef: have —used in place of the contraction 've often in representations of uneducated speech
having lived for many years : old

dt: used to indicate that someone or something is a particular type of person or thing

dt.t: It is not that much {it}of a{/it} problem.
It wasn't that difficult {it}of a{/it} shot.
How big {it}of a{/it} piece do you want?

shortdef: —used to indicate that someone or something is a particular type of person or thing

stems: birds of a feather flock together

dt: {bc}of the same kind or nature {bc}very much alike
usually used in the phrase {phrase}birds of a feather{/phrase}

dt.t: Those two guys are {it}birds of a feather{/it}.

dt: The expression {phrase}birds of a feather flock together{/phrase} means that people who are alike tend to do things together.

shortdef: of the same kind or nature : very much alike —usually used in the phrase birds of a feather

dt: {bc}having existed for a specified period of time

shortdef: having existed for a specified period of time

dt: used to designate something as the greatest moment or event of its kind in a person's life

shortdef: —used to designate something as the greatest moment or event of its kind in a person's life

dt: used to emphasize that a specified person is the person one most or least expect to do or know something

dt.t: You, {it}of all people{/it}, should know the answer to this.
My best friend, {it}of all people{/it}, betrayed me.

shortdef: —used to emphasize that a specified person is the person one most or least expect to do or know something

dt: used to say that it is unusual or surprising that something happened in or is true about a particular place

dt.t: She met her future husband in a grocery store, {it}of all places{/it}.

shortdef: —used to say that it is unusual or surprising that something happened in or is true about a particular place
